title: Grade 5 English Language Arts
teaser: The overarching focus for all modules is building students’ literacy skills as they develop knowledge about the world.

children.title: Becoming a Close-Reader and Writing to Learn: Stories of Human-Rights
children.teaser: Students develop their ability to read and understand complex texts.

children.title: Building Background Knowledge on Human Rights
children.teaser: What are human rights? Why do we have them and how are they protected?

children.title: Getting Ready to Learn about Human-Rights
children.teaser: Students do a close reading of Article-1 of the Universal Declaration of Human Rights.

children.title: Building Background: A Short History of Human Rights
children.teaser: Display learning targets on board, chart paper, or document camera

children.title: Vocabulary Introduction: Human Rights
children.teaser: Review Vocabulary strategies and Think Pair Share and Write- Pair-Share protocols.

children.title: Close Reading: The Introduction to the Universal Declaration of Human-Rights
children.teaser: The Introduction to the Universal Declaration of Human Rights

children.title: Mid-Unit 1 Assessment: Explaining Human Rights
children.teaser: Review Quiz-Quiz-Trade in Vocabulary StrategiesReview Write-Pair-Share and Fist to Five protocols

children.title: Close Reading: “Unpacking” Specific Articles of the UDHR
children.teaser: Students will become “experts” on 11 specific Articles from the UDHR.

children.title: Close Reading: Becoming Experts on Specific Articles of the UDHR
children.teaser: This lesson builds directly on Lesson 6

children.title: Summarizing Complex Ideas
children.teaser: Comparing the Original UDHR and the “Plain Language” Version

children.title: Main-Ideas in Informational Text: Analyzing a Firsthand Human Rights Account
children.teaser: This lesson helps students understand the “So What?” of the UDHR

children.title: Main Ideas in Informational Text
children.teaser: Analyzing a Firsthand Human Rights Account for Connections to Specific Articles of the UDHR

children.title: End of Unit-1 Assessment
children.teaser: On-Demand Analysis of a Human Rights Account

children.title: Case Study: Esperanza’s Story
children.teaser: Students explore how a fictional character responds to human rights challenges.

children.title: Building-Background-Knowledge: Learning About the Historical/Geographical Setting of Esperanza Rising
children.teaser: Students learn about the historical and geographical setting of Esperanza Rising.

children.title: Getting to Know Esperanza
children.teaser: This lesson introduces a new small group structure: Triad Talk.

children.title: Inferring About Characters Based on How They Respond: (Chapter-3: “Las-Papayas”)
children.teaser: This lesson draws directly on the knowledge students built during Unit 1 about human rights.

children.title: Inferring About Characters Based on How They Respond:(Chapter-4: “Los Higos/Figs”)
children.teaser: This lesson builds directly on Lesson 3, reinforcing a pattern of analysis.

children.title: Connecting Informational Text with Literature

children.title: Contrasting Two Settings

children.title: Point of View

children.title: Understanding Themes in Esperanza Rising
children.teaser: This lesson goes into more depth on the concept of theme.

children.title: Characters Changing Over Time

children.title: Building Background Knowledge: Why Do Workers Strike?

children.title: Contrasting-Perspectives: Should the Farmworkers in Esperanza Rising Go on Strike?

children.title: Natural Disasters in the Western Hemisphere

children.title: Synthesizing Information from Texts about Natural Disasters

children.title: Organizing Evidence from Multiple Informational Texts to Prepare for Writing
